oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Roy Acuff Grand Ole Opry Discs: Tape 8
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording features multiple recordings. First, the tape features Tex Ritter (musician) and Roy Acuff (musician). Second, the tape features the Uncloudy Day, a show featuring Mr. and Mrs. Neill Acuff. Lastly, the recording features a number of track recordings featuring: Fred Rose (musician), Joe Melson (musician), John Loudermilk (musician), Jerry Strickland (musician), an Dan Griffin (musician). The only available date is for the Uncloudy Day on June 7, 1941.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Tex Ritter; Roy Acuff; Joe Melson; John Loudermilk; Jerry Strickland; Dan Griffin; Fred Rose
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Tex Ritter as Roy Acuff discuss the Country Music Association -- (01:18) Ritter and Acuff continue their discussion about the Country Music Association -- (15:03) Song [skips] [explicit] (Roy Acuff) -- (17:22) Unidentified ([Unidentified]) -- (19:18) I'm Dying a Sinner's Death ([Unidentified]) -- (22:02) I'm Dying a Sinner's Death (Fred Rose) -- (24:08) Dial a Heartbreak (Joe Melson) -- (27:15) We've Lost the Lust for Living (John Loudermilk) -- (29:32) Gas Up My Mind (Jerry Strickland and Dan Griffin)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Ritter, Tex; Acuff, Roy; Melson, Joe; Loudermilk, John D.; Strickland, Jerry; Griffin, Dan; Rose, Fred, 1897-1954;
